info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 22 at 10:30PM MDT by NWS Cheyenne WY
info.description:
At 1029 PM MDT...A snow squall was along a line extending from West Laramie to near Warren AFB...and moving southeast at 15 mph.
HAZARD...Winds in excess of 25 mph and visibilities less than one mile.
SOURCE...Radar and Webcams.
IMPACT...Hazardous travel conditions due to slick roads and low visibilities.
This dangerous squall will be near... South Cheyenne, Warren AFB, North Crow Campground, University Of Wyoming War Memorial Stadium, Tie City Campground, Granite Springs Reservoir, Crystal Lake Reservoir, Laramie, Cheyenne, and South Greeley Highway around 1035 PM MDT. Winchester Hills around 1040 PM MDT. Vedauwoo, Vedauwoo Campground, and Granite Canon around 1050 PM MDT. Buford and Willadsen Estates around 1055 PM MDT.
Other locations impacted by this dangerous squall include Paddocks, Cowboy Ranch South, Pope Springs, Grass Hills, Albany County Fairgrounds, and Cheyenne Pass.
This includes the following highways... Interstate 25 in Wyoming between mile markers 1 and 16. Interstate 80 in Wyoming between mile markers 306 and 373.
info.instruction:
Expect rapid changes in weather and road conditions. Motorists are urged to use extreme caution if traveling through these areas!
Conditions can deteriorate rapidly in winter weather situations. Be prepared for snow or ice covered roads. Slow down and allow extra time when traveling.
LAT...LON 4137 10569 4118 10460 4101 10451 4100 10561 TIME...MOT...LOC 0429Z 317DEG 15KT 4133 10563 4113 10490

parameter.value: A SNOW SQUALL WILL AFFECT SOUTHEASTERN ALBANY AND SOUTHWESTERN LARAMIE COUNTIES

area.areaDesc: Laramie Valley; South Laramie Range; South Laramie Range Foothills; Central Laramie County
